metadata.title: CVE-2024-41001 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:io_uring/sqpoll: work around a potential audit memory leakkmemleak complains that there's a memory leak related to connecthandling:unreferenced object 0xffff0001093bdf00 (size 128):comm "iou-sqp-455", pid 457, jiffies 4294894164hex dump (first 32 bytes):02 00 fa ea 7f 00 00 01 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00  ................00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00  ................backtrace (crc 2e481b1a):[<00000000c0a26af4>] kmemleak_alloc+0x30/0x38[<000000009c30bb45>] kmalloc_trace+0x228/0x358[<000000009da9d39f>] __audit_sockaddr+0xd0/0x138[<0000000089a93e34>] move_addr_to_kernel+0x1a0/0x1f8[<000000000b4e80e6>] io_connect_prep+0x1ec/0x2d4[<00000000abfbcd99>] io_submit_sqes+0x588/0x1e48[<00000000e7c25e07>] io_sq_thread+0x8a4/0x10e4[<00000000d999b491>] ret_from_fork+0x10/0x20which can can happen if:1) The command type does something on the prep side that triggers an   audit call.2) The thread hasn't done any operations before this that triggered   an audit call inside ->issue(), where we have audit_uring_entry()   and audit_uring_exit().Work around this by issuing a blanket NOP operation before the SQPOLLdoes anything.
